page.title: 19INTERVIEW WITH BLACKO FARMER
page.content: We interviewed Mrs.Ison, the farmer at Brown House. Every morning she gets up at six o'clock and milks the cows, she has a farm man to help. She has sixty cows which give 200 gallons of milk at their best - she is allowed a quota of 200,000 litres a year by the government. She has just bought a Limousin Heifer which cost 1,800 guineas (1,890 pounds). This is a French breed of cattle and Mrs.Ison wants to try and build up a new herd from this. After milking the cows are left to graze while the farmer cleans up. In the daytime the farmer has many jobs like dry-stone walling, diking and fencing. In the summer time the farmers have jobs like cutting grass, collecting it and thistle mowing. In the evening the cows have to be milked again. Mrs Ison goes to market at Otley.
